example.text: A #DefaultOnAmerica would mean: ? Disruptions in #SocialSecurity payments ? Billions in cuts for veterans ? Hikes in unemployment ? Rising costs of living In short, it would be detrimental for hardworking American families.
It's #InfrastructureWeek & we're highlighting investments NYS has already received thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw. ...& the good news is, we are just getting started! [[url]]

Starting May 12, the US will finally drop its COVID vaccine requirement for Canadians entering the US. After 3 years, we are finally at a turning point in rebuilding the relationships between our cross-border communities. [[url]]

Defaulting on our bills means defaulting on families, veterans, retirees, & children. It would have a detrimental impact on our economy, resulting in job loss, a hike in unemployment, & a decline in GDP. We cannot #DefaultOnAmerica. [[url]]

Starting May 12, the US will finally drop its COVID vaccine requirement for Canadians entering the US. After 3 years, we are finally at a turning point in rebuilding the relationships between our cross-border communities. [[url]]

Some say the best way to stop a bad guy with a gun is a good guy with a gun. On 5/14 Aaron Salter Jr. was that guy but his gun was no match for the Buffalo shooter's military-grade armor. That's why [[user]] & I introduced the Aaron Salter Jr. Responsible Body Armor Bill. [[url]]
